title.value: Socially Assistive Robots for patients with Alzheimer’s Disease: A scoping review
title.justification: The title clearly summarizes the subject of the paper: a review of socially assistive robots for Alzheimer’s Disease patients.
title.quote: Socially Assistive Robots for patients with Alzheimer’s Disease: A scoping review

extractions.description: This research paper presents a scoping review on the use of socially assistive robots (SARs) for patients with Alzheimer's Disease (AD), focusing on daily life support, cognitive assessment, and cognitive therapy. The paper discusses the interaction of these robots with AD patients and highlights their potential benefits along with current knowledge gaps.

type.justification: The paper conducts a scoping review, which is based on collecting and analyzing data from existing studies on SARs for Alzheimer's patients, thus it is empirical in nature.
type.quote: We performed a scoping review informed by the methodological framework of Arksey and O’Malley and adhered to the Preferred Reporting Items for Systematic Reviews and Meta-Analyses extension for Scoping Reviews (PRISMA-ScR) checklist for reporting the results.

name.value: Gerontology and Geriatrics with a focus on Robotics
name.justification: The paper discusses the role of socially assistive robots for patients with Alzheimer's Disease, which relates to studies in gerontology and geriatrics, specifically within the context of robotics applications for elderly care.
name.quote: Socially Assistive Robots for patients with Alzheimer’s Disease: A scoping review

name.value: Robotics and Artificial Intelligence in Healthcare
name.justification: The paper heavily discusses the integration of AI in SARs and their application in healthcare for Alzheimer's patients.
name.quote: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a subfield of computer science that can analyze complex big data... Recent advancements in AI have shown promise with use and reliability of SAR in the field of dementia.

name.justification: NAO is explicitly mentioned as one of the robots used in studies reviewed in the paper, highlighting its application in social robotics for Alzheimer's care.

is_contributed.justification: NAO is referenced as part of the review and not introduced as a new contribution by this paper.

is_executed.justification: The paper does not detail experimental execution on NAO; it reviews existing literature mentioning this robot.
is_executed.quote: NAO is a human-like robot, was used more than other robots in the studies we reviewed.

is_compared.justification: There is no explicit numerical comparison of NAO against other models within this paper; it's more of a qualitative assessment.
is_compared.quote: They could be divided into three types: human-like robots, animal-like robots, and unfamiliar/other types of robots.

referenced_paper_title.value: Realization and User Evaluation of a Companion Robot for People with Mild Cognitive Impairments
referenced_paper_title.justification: This paper mentions NAO as used in studies reviewed, particularly focused on assistive roles for dementia patients.
referenced_paper_title.quote: NAO can move and adapt to the environment... to interact with humans in 20 languages (De Carolis, Palestra, & Pino, 2019).

name.justification: PARO is listed as one of the commonly used robots in the reviewed studies, known for its therapeutic applications.

is_contributed.justification: PARO is reviewed based on existing literature; it’s not introduced in this paper as a new contribution.

is_executed.justification: The paper mentions the use of PARO in literature but does not perform experiments with it in their own study.
is_executed.quote: PARO is employed in the welfare and medical sectors in several developed countries and regions.

is_compared.justification: The paper reviews the use of PARO qualitatively; it does not provide a quantitative comparison against other robots.
is_compared.quote: PARO was the second-most commonly used robot in the studies reviewed.

referenced_paper_title.value: Robot therapy for elders affected by dementia
referenced_paper_title.justification: This title is provided as part of studies reviewed involving PARO, indicating its application for therapy in dementia.
referenced_paper_title.quote: PARO is employed in welfare... Previous studies found PARO effective in different areas... (Inoue et al., 2021).

name.justification: Pepper is another robot frequently cited in the reviewed studies for its social capabilities in cognitive therapy.

is_contributed.justification: Pepper is discussed as part of existing research; it’s not a new innovation by the authors of this paper.

is_executed.justification: The usage of Pepper is described based on other studies; this paper itself does not execute or test it anew.
is_executed.quote: Pepper can move naturally... interacting with humans by talking through its sensors.

is_compared.justification: There is no numerical comparison provided for Pepper against other models; the discussion is qualitative.
is_compared.quote: Pepper is employed in the reviewed literature for cognitive therapy as part of SAR interventions.

referenced_paper_title.value: The utilization of robotic pets in dementia care
referenced_paper_title.justification: Pepper's mention aligns with broader therapeutic applications similar to PARO, as indicated by studies like this in the reviewed content.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Pepper can move naturally... interacting with humans by talking through its sensors (Varrasi et al., 2019).
